page.title: 20Bury St. Edmunds Golf Club
page.content: Designated "parkland" class, it has an 18-hole course. The standard scratch score is 72, the length just over 6800 yards with the usual hazards of undergrowth, bunkers and trees. The addition of water hazards is being considered. Founded in the 1920s, originally the railway ran through it. When the inproved A45 was built and the town required land for the Howard housing estate, part of the course was compulsorily purchased, this being replaced by buying farmland. A new clubhouse was built, to which 2 squash courts have recently been added. Businessmen entertain clients to meals there in pleasant surroundings without parking problems. There are about 700 golf, squash and social members, of whom about 300 play golf regularly.
